intro: Plagiogyria serrulata, commonly known as the serrated plagiogyria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense, compact inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural environment.
